title: 107_hr1786
content: IMPOSITION OF TARIFF-RATE QUOTAS ON CERTAIN CASEIN AND MILK CONCENTRATES. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to impose a quantitative limitation on the entry of casein, caseinates, milk protein concentrate, and other derivatives. The aggregate quantity allowed in a calendar year is set at 54,051,000 kilograms, with products from Mexico excluded from this limitation. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to impose a quantitative limitation on derivatives and glues by updating subheadings 3501.10 through 3501.90.60. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to impose a quantitative limitation on milk protein concentrate under subheadings 3501.10.05 and 3501.10.15. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States imposes a quantitative limitation on milk protein concentrate under subheadings 3501.10.05 and 3501.10.15. Other items under subheading 3501.10.20 are priced at $2.16/kg and are duty-free for Mexico, while items under subheading 3501.10.55 are duty-free for several countries for industrial uses other than food production. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States imposes quantitative limitations on milk protein concentrate under subheadings 3501.10.05 and 3501.10.15. Other items under subheading 3501.10.20 are priced at $2.16/kg and duty-free for Mexico, while items under subheading 3501.10.55 are duty-free for several countries for industrial uses other than food production. Items under subheadings 3501.10.60 and 3501.10.65 are described in specific tariff notes and have varying duty rates for different countries. Items under subheading 3501.90.05 and 3501.90.30 have a 6% duty rate and are duty-free for several countries for industrial uses other than food production. Items under subheading 3501.90.55 and 3501.90.65 are described in general note 15 of the tariff schedule and have a duty rate of 0.37 cents/kg. They are duty-free for several countries including A*, CA, E, IL, and J, with a duty rate of 12.1 cents/kg for MX. The U.S. note 2 to this chapter states that under subheading 3501.90.70, the duty rate is $2.16/kg and duty-free for Mexico at $2.81/kg. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to restrict the quantity of milk protein concentrates entered under certain subheadings to 15,818,000 kilograms per year. Products from Mexico are exempt from this limitation. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to restrict the quantity of milk protein concentrates entered under certain subheadings, with exemptions for products from Mexico. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to restrict the quantity of milk protein concentrates entered under certain subheadings, with exemptions for products from Mexico. Milk protein concentrates described in general note 15 and additional U.S. note 27 are subject to specific tariffs. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States restricts milk protein concentrates entry under specific subheadings, with exemptions for Mexican products. Milk protein concentrates under certain subheadings have specific tariffs. The amendments made by this section apply to goods entered on or after the first day of the first month after the date that is 15 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The President can enter into trade agreements with foreign countries to grant new concessions. Any modifications to existing duties must not decrease the rate to less than 70 percent of the current rate. The President can reduce duty rates by up to 30% at each stage under the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988. The final duty rate must not be less than 70% of the original rate. The President can round up duty calculations if it simplifies the process. The duty rate can be reduced to the next lower whole number or one-half of one percent ad valorem.
